comments:
I tried to create an ANT builder for a project.
After starting the creation I was able to select the build file (clicking on
"Browse Workspace...").
Not changing anything on "Refresh" I tried to select a target for "Manual Build"
on "Targets". The result was a vanishing eclipse (although javaw.exe stays in
memory) and this entry in the .log:
!SESSION Mon Feb 21 09:24:23 CET 2005 ------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 21, 2005 09:24:23.468
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:167)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:268)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:260)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:887)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:871)

Executing an already existing builder (created with 3.1.M4) lead to the same result.

I forgot to mention the java version:
java.vm.version=1.5.0_01-b08

(In reply to comment #0)

Same thing occurs simply attempting to open a build.xml file for editing.  No
need to actually try and build using an Ant builder.  I can create a build.xml
as a new simple file, but as soon as I put XML into it, subsequent open
operations on build.xml cause Eclipse to crash as described in #0.  This is with
a similiar environment by the way.

I believe you are specifying -Xverify:none when running Eclipse?

This is causing problems with the Ant security manager created for bug 60860. 
This appears to be a duplicate of bug 85908.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 85908 ***
